transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good morning, meena. thanks for joining today. this interview will focus on your experience as a business analyst, especially around requirement gathering and stakeholder interaction. lets start with your background.

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: good morning. i have about two years of experience working as a business analyst. i mainly support reporting activities and help teams with documentation when required.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you describe your typical day-to-day responsibilities in your current role?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i usually work on preparing reports, updating trackers, and coordinating with internal teams to collect information.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: when a new requirement comes in, how do you usually capture and document it?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: normally, i receive requirements through emails or meetings, and i note down the points shared.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: do you follow any structured approach for requirement gathering, like interviews, workshops, or questionnaires?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: not really. i mostly rely on what stakeholders share during meetings.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you created formal documents such as business requirement documents (brd) or functional requirement documents (frd)?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no, i havent created those documents myself. i have only reviewed them occasionally.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: how do you ensure that the requirements you collect are clear and complete?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i usually confirm with stakeholders informally, but i dont follow a specific validation process.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked closely with technical teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have interacted with technical teams, but i usually pass on high-level information.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you explain any techniques you use for requirement prioritization?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: im not very familiar with prioritization techniques. i usually work on tasks as instructed.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: alright. that gives me a good picture. do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no questions. thank you for the discussion.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you, meena. we appreciate your time and will get back to you regarding next steps.
